qas.question: What other causes are there for inflammatory diarrhea?

plausible_answers.text: when there is damage to the mucosal lining or brush border
a passive loss of protein-rich fluids and a decreased ability to absorb these lost fluids

qas.question: What is damaged when color cancer occurs?

context: Inflammatory diarrhea occurs <a0_0><b4_0>when there is damage to <b8_0>the mucosal lining or brush border<b8_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, which leads to <a1_0><b5_0>a passive loss of protein-rich fluids and a decreased ability to absorb these lost fluids<b5_0/><a1_0/>. Features of all three of the other types of diarrhea[clarification needed] can be found in this type of diarrhea. It can be caused by <a2_0><b7_0>bacterial infections, viral infections, parasitic infections, or autoimmune problems<b7_0/><a2_0/> such as inflammatory bowel diseases. It can also be caused by <a3_0><b6_0>tuberculosis, colon cancer, and enteritis<b6_0/>.<a3_0/>[citation needed]
